001package com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb;
002
003import com.badlogic.gdx.Gdx;
004import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.*;
005import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch;
006import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion;
007import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShaderProgram;
008import com.badlogic.gdx.math.Affine2;
009import com.badlogic.gdx.math.MathUtils;
010import com.badlogic.gdx.math.Matrix4;
011import com.badlogic.gdx.utils.NumberUtils;
012
013import java.nio.Buffer;
014
015/**
016 * A substitute for {@link com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch} that adds an additional attribute to store an
017 * extra color's worth of channels, used to modify the RGB channels of a color by multiplication (called the "tweak")
018 * while the primary color affects the color additively (just called the color, often drawn from {@link Palette} or
019 * generated with {@link ColorTools}). This ColorfulBatch uses the RGB color space, like SpriteBatch, but the batch
020 * color here is additive for the red, green, and blue channels, while the tweak is multiplicative, and the neutral
021 * value for all RGB channels is 0.5 (instead of 1.0 for SpriteBatch). Additive values cause no change when they are
022 * 0.5, but cause a sharp increase at 1.0 and a sharp decrease at 0.0. In the tweak, r maps to multiplicative red,
023 * g maps to multiplicative green, b maps to multiplicative blue, and a maps to "exponential-like" contrast. Like with
024 * the additive values, 0.5 causes no change for multiplicative values, but you can think of the existing color as being
025 * temporarily shifted down by 0.5 for each of the RGB channels, so each RGB channel's range is -0.5 to 0.5 before being
026 * multiplied by the corresponding tweak value (times 2.0, which means multiplicative tweak values less than 0.5 make
027 * colors darker and values greater than 0.5 make colors lighter) and then shifted back to its prior range. Contrast is
028 * a special value; 0.5 still means "no change," but lower values will make lightness changes less distinct between
029 * similar colors, while higher values will "sharpen" the changes in lightness.
030 * <br>
031 * Created by Tommy Ettinger on 12/14/2019.
032 */
033public class ColorfulBatch implements Batch {
034    public static final int SPRITE_SIZE = 24;
035    public static final String TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE = "a_tweak";
036
037    private Mesh mesh;
038
039    private final float[] vertices;
040    private int idx = 0;
041    private Texture lastTexture = null;
042    private float invTexWidth = 0, invTexHeight = 0;
043
044    private boolean drawing = false;
045
046    private final Matrix4 transformMatrix = new Matrix4();
047    private final Matrix4 projectionMatrix = new Matrix4();
048    private final Matrix4 combinedMatrix = new Matrix4();
049
050    private boolean blendingDisabled = false;
051    private int blendSrcFunc = GL20.GL_SRC_ALPHA;
052    private int blendDstFunc = GL20.GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA;
053    private int blendSrcFuncAlpha = GL20.GL_SRC_ALPHA;
054    private int blendDstFuncAlpha = GL20.GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA;
055
056    private final ShaderProgram shader;
057    private ShaderProgram customShader = null;
058    private boolean ownsShader;
059
060    protected float color = Palette.GRAY;
061    private final Color tempColor = new Color(0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f, 1f);
062
063    /**
064     * A constant packed float that can be assigned to this ColorfulBatch's tweak with {@link #setTweak(float)} to make
065     * all of the tweak adjustments virtually imperceptible. When this is set as the tweak, it won't change the
066     * lightness multiplier or lightness contrast, and it won't change either chromatic value multiplier.
067     */
068    public static final float TWEAK_RESET = ColorTools.rgb(0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f);
069    protected float tweak = TWEAK_RESET;
070
071    /** Number of render calls since the last {@link #begin()}. **/
072    public int renderCalls = 0;
073
074    /** Number of rendering calls, ever. Will not be reset unless set manually. **/
075    public int totalRenderCalls = 0;
076
077    /** The maximum number of sprites rendered in one batch so far. **/
078    public int maxSpritesInBatch = 0;
079
080    /** Constructs a new ColorfulBatch with a size of 1000, one buffer, and the default shader.
081     * @see #ColorfulBatch(int, ShaderProgram) */
082    public ColorfulBatch() {
083        this(1000, null);
084    }
085
086    /** Constructs a ColorfulBatch with one buffer and the default shader.
087     * @see #ColorfulBatch(int, ShaderProgram)  */
088    public ColorfulBatch(int size) {
089        this(size, null);
090    }
091
092    /** Constructs a new ColorfulBatch. Sets the projection matrix to an orthographic projection with y-axis point upwards, x-axis
093     * point to the right and the origin being in the bottom left corner of the screen. The projection will be pixel perfect with
094     * respect to the current screen resolution.
095     * <p>
096     * The defaultShader specifies the shader to use. Note that the names for uniforms for this default shader are different than
097     * the ones expect for shaders set with {@link #setShader(ShaderProgram)}. See {@link #createDefaultShader()}.
098     * @param size The max number of sprites in a single batch. Max of 10922.
099     * @param defaultShader The default shader to use. This is not owned by the ColorfulBatch and must be disposed separately. */
100    public ColorfulBatch(int size, ShaderProgram defaultShader) {
101        // 65535 is max vertex index, so 65535 / 6 vertices per sprite = 10922 sprites max.
102        if (size > 10922) throw new IllegalArgumentException("Can't have more than 10922 sprites per batch: " + size);
103
104        Mesh.VertexDataType vertexDataType = (Gdx.gl30 != null) ? Mesh.VertexDataType.VertexBufferObjectWithVAO : Mesh.VertexDataType.VertexArray;
105
106        mesh = new Mesh(vertexDataType, false, size * 4, size * 6,
107                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.Position, 2, ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE),
108                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.ColorPacked, 4, ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE),
109                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.TextureCoordinates, 2, ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0"),
110                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.ColorPacked, 4, TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE));
111
112        projectionMatrix.setToOrtho2D(0, 0, Gdx.graphics.getWidth(), Gdx.graphics.getHeight());
113
114        vertices = new float[size * SPRITE_SIZE];
115
116        int len = size * 6;
117        short[] indices = new short[len];
118        short j = 0;
119        for (int i = 0; i < len; i += 6, j += 4) {
120            indices[i] = j;
121            indices[i + 1] = (short)(j + 1);
122            indices[i + 2] = (short)(j + 2);
123            indices[i + 3] = (short)(j + 2);
124            indices[i + 4] = (short)(j + 3);
125            indices[i + 5] = j;
126        }
127        mesh.setIndices(indices);
128
129        if (defaultShader == null) {
130            shader = createDefaultShader();
131            ownsShader = true;
132        } else
133            shader = defaultShader;
134    }
135
136    //// Previous shader used the IPT recommendation for intensity as its lightness calculation:
137    //  "  tgt.rgb *= pow(dot(vec3(0.189786, 0.576951, 0.233221), tgt.rgb) + 0.625, v_tweak.a) * v_lightFix;\n" +
138    //// It also didn't use sqrt() or any non-linearity.
139    /** Returns a new instance of the default shader used by ColorfulBatch for GL2 when no shader is specified. */
140    public static ShaderProgram createDefaultShader () {
141        String vertexShader = "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
142                + "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
143                + "attribute vec2 " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
144                + "attribute vec4 " + TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
145                + "uniform mat4 u_projTrans;\n"
146                + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
147                + "varying vec4 v_tweak;\n"
148                + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
149                + "varying float v_lightFix;\n"
150                + "\n"
151                + "void main()\n"
152                + "{\n"
153                + "   v_color = " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
154                + "   v_color.rgb = v_color.rgb * 0.5 - 0.25;\n"
155                + "   v_color.a = v_color.a * (255.0/254.0);\n"
156                + "   v_tweak = " + TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
157                + "   v_tweak.a = v_tweak.a * (255.0/254.0);\n"
158                + "   v_lightFix = 1.0 + pow(v_tweak.a + 0.5, 1.41421356);\n"
159                //// old; may have produced NaN when a negative v_tweak.a was raised to a power.
160//                + "   v_tweak.a = v_tweak.a * (153.0/127.0) - 0.6;\n" // -0.6 to 0.6 range
161//                + "   v_lightFix = 2.0 * (1.0 + pow(v_tweak.a, 1.4));\n"
162                + "   v_texCoords = " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
163                + "   gl_Position =  u_projTrans * " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
164                + "}\n";
165        String fragmentShader =
166                "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
167                        "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
168                        "precision mediump float;\n" +
169                        "#else\n" +
170                        "#define LOWP \n" +
171                        "#endif\n" +
172                        "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
173                        "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
174                        "varying LOWP vec4 v_tweak;\n" +
175                        "varying float v_lightFix;\n" +
176                        "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
177                        "void main()\n" +
178                        "{\n" +
179                        "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
180                        "  tgt.rgb = clamp(tgt.rgb * v_tweak.rgb + v_color.rgb, 0.0, 1.0);\n" +
181                        "  tgt.rgb *= pow(sqrt(dot(vec3(0.2627, 0.6780, 0.0593), tgt.rgb)) + 0.5, v_tweak.a) * v_lightFix;\n" +
182                        "  tgt.a *= v_color.a;\n" +
183                        "  gl_FragColor = clamp(tgt, 0.0, 1.0);\n" +
184                        "}";
185
186
187        ShaderProgram shader = new ShaderProgram(vertexShader, fragmentShader);
188        if (!shader.isCompiled()) throw new IllegalArgumentException("Error compiling shader: " + shader.getLog());
189        return shader;
190    }
191
192    @Override
193    public void begin () {
194        if (drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.end must be called before begin.");
195        renderCalls = 0;
196
197        Gdx.gl.glDepthMask(false);
198        if (customShader != null)
199            customShader.bind();
200        else
201            shader.bind();
202        setupMatrices();
203
204        drawing = true;
205    }
206
207    @Override
208    public void end () {
209        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before end.");
210        if (idx > 0) flush();
211        lastTexture = null;
212        drawing = false;
213
214        GL20 gl = Gdx.gl;
215        gl.glDepthMask(true);
216        if (isBlendingEnabled()) gl.glDisable(GL20.GL_BLEND);
217    }
218
219    @Override
220    public void setColor (Color tint) {
221        color = tint.toFloatBits();
222    }
223
224    /**
225     * Sets the color to the result of {@link ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)} on the same arguments.
226     * For the RGB parameters, 0.5f is a neutral value (causing no change), while for alpha, 1.0f is a neutral
227     * value. For RGB, higher values will add to the corresponding channel, while lower values will subtract from it.
228     * @see ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)
229     * @param red additive red channel, from 0 to 1; 0.5 is neutral
230     * @param green additive green channel, from 0 to 1; 0.5 is neutral
231     * @param blue additive blue channel, from 0 to 1; 0.5 is neutral
232     * @param alpha multiplicative opacity, from 0 to 1; 1.0 is neutral
233     */
234    @Override
235    public void setColor (float red, float green, float blue, float alpha) {
236        color = ColorTools.rgb(red, green, blue, alpha);
237    }
238
239    public void setColor (final float color) {
240        setPackedColor(color);
241    }
242
243    public void setIntColor(final int color) {
244        this.color = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat(Integer.reverseBytes(color & -2));
245    }
246
247    /**
248     * Sets the color with the given RGB and A parameters from 0 to 255.
249     * For the RGB parameters, 127 is a neutral value (causing no change), while for alpha, 255 is a neutral
250     * value. For RGB, higher values will add to the corresponding channel, while lower values will subtract from it.
251     * @see ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)
252     * @param red additive red channel; ranges from 0 to 255, and 127 is neutral
253     * @param green additive green channel; ranges from 0 to 255, and 127 is neutral
254     * @param blue additive blue channel; ranges from 0 to 255, and 127 is neutral
255     * @param alpha multiplicative opacity; ranges from 0 to 255 (254 is equivalent, since the lowest bit is discarded)
256     */
257    public void setIntColor(int red, int green, int blue, int alpha) {
258        color = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat((alpha << 24 & 0xFE000000)
259                | (blue << 16 & 0xFF0000) | (green << 8 & 0xFF00) | (red & 0xFF));
260    }
261
262    @Override
263    public void setPackedColor (final float color) {
264        this.color = color;
265    }
266
267    @Override
268    public Color getColor () {
269        final int intBits = NumberUtils.floatToRawIntBits(color);
270        Color color = tempColor;
271        color.r = (intBits & 0xff) / 255f;
272        color.g = ((intBits >>> 8) & 0xff) / 255f;
273        color.b = ((intBits >>> 16) & 0xff) / 255f;
274        color.a = ((intBits >>> 24) & 0xff) / 255f;
275        return color;
276    }
277
278    @Override
279    public float getPackedColor () {
280        return color;
281    }
282
283    /**
284     * Sets the multiplicative and contrast parts of the shader's color changes. 0.5 is a neutral value that should have
285     * minimal effect on the image; using {@code (0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f)} will effectively remove the tweak. You can
286     * also use {@link #setTweak(float)} with {@link #TWEAK_RESET}, which is very slightly more efficient, to remove the
287     * tweak or set it to a neutral value.
288     * @param red multiplicative red channel, from 0 to 1; 0.5 is neutral
289     * @param green multiplicative green channel, from 0 to 1; 0.5 is neutral
290     * @param blue multiplicative blue channel, from 0 to 1; 0.5 is neutral
291     * @param contrast affects how lightness changes, from 0 (low contrast, cloudy look) to 1 (high contrast, sharpened look); 0.5 is neutral
292     */
293    public void setTweak (float red, float green, float blue, float contrast) {
294        tweak = ColorTools.rgb(red, green, blue, contrast);
295    }
296    /**
297     * Sets the tweak using a single packed RGB float.
298     * @see #setTweak(float, float, float, float)
299     * @param tweak a packed RGB float, with contrast instead of alpha
300     */
301    public void setTweak (final float tweak) {
302        this.tweak = tweak;
303    }
304    
305    public float getTweak () {
306        return tweak;
307    }
308
309    /**
310     * Takes the tweak as an int in the format: red (8 bits), green (8 bits), blue (8 bits), contrast (7 bits),
311     * (1 ignored bit at the end). An example would be 0xC820206E, which significantly emphasizes red (with red 0xC8,
312     * a little over 3/4 of the max and higher than the neutral value of 0x80), significantly reduces green and blue
313     * effect with green and blue multipliers of 0x20 (closer to 0, so most green and blue in the final color, if any,
314     * will come from the additive color), and slightly reduces contrast (with contrast and the ignored bit as 0x6E,
315     * which is less than the halfway point).
316     * @param tweak the tweak to use as an integer, with red in the most significant bits and contrast in least
317     */
318    public void setIntTweak(final int tweak) {
319        this.tweak = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat(Integer.reverseBytes(tweak & -2));
320    }
321
322    /**
323     * Sets the multiplicative and contrast parts of the shader's color changes. 127 is a neutral value that should have
324     * minimal effect on the image; using {@code (127, 127, 127, 127)} will effectively remove the tweak.
325     * @param red multiplicative red channel, from 0 to 255; 127 is neutral
326     * @param green multiplicative green channel, from 0 to 255; 127 is neutral
327     * @param blue multiplicative blue channel, from 0 to 255; 127 is neutral
328     * @param contrast affects how lightness changes, from 0 (low contrast, cloudy look) to 255 (high contrast, sharpened look); 127 is neutral
329     */
330    public void setIntTweak(int red, int green, int blue, int contrast) {
331        tweak = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat((contrast << 24 & 0xFE000000)
332                | (blue << 16 & 0xFF0000) | (green << 8 & 0xFF00) | (red & 0xFF));
333    }
334
335    /**
336     * A convenience method that sets both the color (with {@link #setColor(float)}) and the tweak (with
337     * {@link #setTweak(float)}) at the same time.
338     * @param color the additive components and alpha, as a packed float
339     * @param tweak the multiplicative components and contrast, as a packed float
340     */
341    public void setTweakedColor(final float color, final float tweak) {
342        setColor(color);
343        setTweak(tweak);
344    }
345    /**
346     * A convenience method that sets both the color (with {@link #setColor(float, float, float, float)}) and the tweak
347     * (with {@link #setTweak(float, float, float, float)}) at the same time.
348     * @param redAdd additive red channel, from 0 to 1; 0.5 is neutral
349     * @param greenAdd additive green channel, from 0 to 1; 0.5 is neutral
350     * @param blueAdd additive blue channel, from 0 to 1; 0.5 is neutral
351     * @param alphaMul multiplicative alpha channel, from 0 to 1; 1.0 is neutral
352     * @param redMul multiplicative red channel, from 0 to 1; 0.5 is neutral
353     * @param greenMul multiplicative green channel, from 0 to 1; 0.5 is neutral
354     * @param blueMul multiplicative blue channel, from 0 to 1; 0.5 is neutral
355     * @param contrast affects how lightness changes, from 0 (low contrast, cloudy look) to 1 (high contrast, sharpened look); 0.5 is neutral
356     */
357    public void setTweakedColor (final float redAdd, final float greenAdd,
358                                 final float blueAdd, final float alphaMul,
359                                 final float redMul, final float greenMul,
360                                 final float blueMul, final float contrast) {
361        setColor(redAdd, greenAdd, blueAdd, alphaMul);
362        setTweak(redMul, greenMul, blueMul, contrast);
363    }
364
365
366    @Override
367    public void draw (Texture texture, float x, float y, float originX, float originY, float width, float height, float scaleX,
368                      float scaleY, float rotation, int srcX, int srcY, int srcWidth, int srcHeight, boolean flipX, boolean flipY) {
369        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
370
371        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
372
373        if (texture != lastTexture)
374            switchTexture(texture);
375        else if (idx == vertices.length)
376            flush();
377
378        // bottom left and top right corner points relative to origin
379        final float worldOriginX = x + originX;
380        final float worldOriginY = y + originY;
381        float fx = -originX;
382        float fy = -originY;
383        float fx2 = width - originX;
384        float fy2 = height - originY;
385
386        // scale
387        if (scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) {
388            fx *= scaleX;
389            fy *= scaleY;
390            fx2 *= scaleX;
391            fy2 *= scaleY;
392        }
393
394        // construct corner points, start from top left and go counter clockwise
395        final float p1x = fx;
396        final float p1y = fy;
397        final float p2x = fx;
398        final float p2y = fy2;
399        final float p3x = fx2;
400        final float p3y = fy2;
401        final float p4x = fx2;
402        final float p4y = fy;
403
404        float x1;
405        float y1;
406        float x2;
407        float y2;
408        float x3;
409        float y3;
410        float x4;
411        float y4;
412
413        // rotate
414        if (rotation != 0) {
415            final float cos = MathUtils.cosDeg(rotation);
416            final float sin = MathUtils.sinDeg(rotation);
417
418            x1 = cos * p1x - sin * p1y;
419            y1 = sin * p1x + cos * p1y;
420
421            x2 = cos * p2x - sin * p2y;
422            y2 = sin * p2x + cos * p2y;
423
424            x3 = cos * p3x - sin * p3y;
425            y3 = sin * p3x + cos * p3y;
426
427            x4 = x1 + (x3 - x2);
428            y4 = y3 - (y2 - y1);
429        } else {
430            x1 = p1x;
431            y1 = p1y;
432
433            x2 = p2x;
434            y2 = p2y;
435
436            x3 = p3x;
437            y3 = p3y;
438
439            x4 = p4x;
440            y4 = p4y;
441        }
442
443        x1 += worldOriginX;
444        y1 += worldOriginY;
445        x2 += worldOriginX;
446        y2 += worldOriginY;
447        x3 += worldOriginX;
448        y3 += worldOriginY;
449        x4 += worldOriginX;
450        y4 += worldOriginY;
451
452        float u = srcX * invTexWidth;
453        float v = (srcY + srcHeight) * invTexHeight;
454        float u2 = (srcX + srcWidth) * invTexWidth;
455        float v2 = srcY * invTexHeight;
456
457        if (flipX) {
458            float tmp = u;
459            u = u2;
460            u2 = tmp;
461        }
462
463        if (flipY) {
464            float tmp = v;
465            v = v2;
466            v2 = tmp;
467        }
468
469        final float color = this.color;
470        final float tweak = this.tweak;
471        final int idx = this.idx;
472        vertices[idx] = x1;
473        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
474        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
475        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
476        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
477        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
478
479        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
480        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
481        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
482        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
483        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
484        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
485
486        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
487        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
488        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
489        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
490        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
491        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
492
493        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
494        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
495        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
496        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
497        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
498        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
499        this.idx = idx + 24;
500    }
501
502    @Override
503    public void draw (Texture texture, float x, float y, float width, float height, int srcX, int srcY, int srcWidth,
504                      int srcHeight, boolean flipX, boolean flipY) {
505        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
506
507        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
508
509        if (texture != lastTexture)
510            switchTexture(texture);
511        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
512            flush();
513
514        float u = srcX * invTexWidth;
515        float v = (srcY + srcHeight) * invTexHeight;
516        float u2 = (srcX + srcWidth) * invTexWidth;
517        float v2 = srcY * invTexHeight;
518        final float fx2 = x + width;
519        final float fy2 = y + height;
520
521        if (flipX) {
522            float tmp = u;
523            u = u2;
524            u2 = tmp;
525        }
526
527        if (flipY) {
528            float tmp = v;
529            v = v2;
530            v2 = tmp;
531        }
532
533        final float color = this.color;
534        final float tweak = this.tweak;
535        final int idx = this.idx;
536        vertices[idx] = x;
537        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
538        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
539        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
540        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
541        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
542
543        vertices[idx + 6] = x;
544        vertices[idx + 7] = fy2;
545        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
546        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
547        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
548        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
549
550        vertices[idx + 12] = fx2;
551        vertices[idx + 13] = fy2;
552        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
553        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
554        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
555        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
556
557        vertices[idx + 18] = fx2;
558        vertices[idx + 19] = y;
559        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
560        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
561        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
562        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
563        this.idx = idx + 24;
564    }
565
566    @Override
567    public void draw (Texture texture, float x, float y, int srcX, int srcY, int srcWidth, int srcHeight) {
568        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
569
570        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
571
572        if (texture != lastTexture)
573            switchTexture(texture);
574        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
575            flush();
576
577        final float u = srcX * invTexWidth;
578        final float v = (srcY + srcHeight) * invTexHeight;
579        final float u2 = (srcX + srcWidth) * invTexWidth;
580        final float v2 = srcY * invTexHeight;
581        final float fx2 = x + srcWidth;
582        final float fy2 = y + srcHeight;
583
584        final float color = this.color;
585        final float tweak = this.tweak;
586        final int idx = this.idx;
587        vertices[idx] = x;
588        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
589        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
590        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
591        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
592        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
593
594        vertices[idx + 6] = x;
595        vertices[idx + 7] = fy2;
596        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
597        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
598        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
599        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
600
601        vertices[idx + 12] = fx2;
602        vertices[idx + 13] = fy2;
603        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
604        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
605        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
606        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
607
608        vertices[idx + 18] = fx2;
609        vertices[idx + 19] = y;
610        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
611        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
612        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
613        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
614        this.idx = idx + 24;
615    }
616

619        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
620

622
623        if (texture != lastTexture)

625        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
626            flush();

630

632        final float tweak = this.tweak;

634        vertices[idx] = x;
635        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
636        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
637        vertices[idx + 3] = u;

664    @Override
665    public void draw (Texture texture, float x, float y) {
666        draw(texture, x, y, texture.getWidth(), texture.getHeight());
667    }
668
669    @Override
670    public void draw (Texture texture, float x, float y, float width, float height) {
671        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
672
673        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
674
675        if (texture != lastTexture)
676            switchTexture(texture);
677        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
678            flush();
679
680        final float fx2 = x + width;
681        final float fy2 = y + height;
682        final float u = 0;
683        final float v = 1;
684        final float u2 = 1;
685        final float v2 = 0;
686
687        final float color = this.color;
688        final float tweak = this.tweak;
689        final int idx = this.idx;
690        vertices[idx] = x;
691        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
692        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
693        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
694        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
695        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
696
697        vertices[idx + 6] = x;
698        vertices[idx + 7] = fy2;
699        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
700        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
701        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
702        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
703
704        vertices[idx + 12] = fx2;
705        vertices[idx + 13] = fy2;
706        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
707        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
708        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
709        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
710
711        vertices[idx + 18] = fx2;
712        vertices[idx + 19] = y;
713        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
714        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
715        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
716        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
717        this.idx = idx + 24;
718    }
719
720    /**
721     * This is very different from the other overloads in this class; it assumes the float array it is given is in the
722     * format libGDX uses to give to SpriteBatch, that is, in groups of 20 floats per sprite. ColorfulBatch uses 24
723     * floats per sprite, to add tweak per color, so this does some conversion.
724     * @param texture the Texture being drawn from; usually an atlas or some parent Texture with lots of TextureRegions
725     * @param spriteVertices not the same format as {@link #vertices} in this class; should have a length that's a multiple of 20
726     * @param offset where to start drawing vertices from {@code spriteVertices}
727     * @param count how many vertices to draw from {@code spriteVertices} (20 vertices is one sprite)
728     */
729    @Override
730    public void draw (Texture texture, float[] spriteVertices, int offset, int count) {
731        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
732
733        count = (count / 5) * 6;
734        int verticesLength = vertices.length;
735        int remainingVertices = verticesLength;
736        if (texture != lastTexture)
737            switchTexture(texture);
738        else {
739            remainingVertices -= idx;
740            if (remainingVertices == 0) {
741                flush();
742                remainingVertices = verticesLength;
743            }
744        }
745        int copyCount = Math.min(remainingVertices, count);
746        final float tweak = this.tweak;
747
748        ////old way, breaks when libGDX code expects SPRITE_SIZE to be 20
749        //System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, idx, copyCount);
750        ////new way, thanks mgsx
751        for (int s = offset, v = idx, i = 0; i < copyCount; i += 6) {
752            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
753            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
754            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
755            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
756            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
757            vertices[v++] = tweak;
758        }
759        idx += copyCount;
760        count -= copyCount;
761        while (count > 0) {
762            offset += (copyCount / 6) * 5;
763            flush();
764            copyCount = Math.min(verticesLength, count);
765            ////old way, breaks when libGDX code expects SPRITE_SIZE to be 20
766            //System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, 0, copyCount);
767            ////new way, thanks mgsx
768            for (int s = offset, v = 0, i = 0; i < copyCount; i += 6) {
769                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
770                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
771                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
772                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
773                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
774                vertices[v++] = tweak;
775            }
776            idx += copyCount;
777            count -= copyCount;
778        }
779    }
780
781    /**
782     * Meant for code that uses ColorfulBatch specifically and can set an extra float (for the color tweak) per vertex,
783     * this is just like {@link #draw(Texture, float[], int, int)} when used in other Batch implementations, but expects
784     * {@code spriteVertices} to have a length that is a multiple of 24 instead of 20.
785     * @param texture the Texture being drawn from; usually an atlas or some parent Texture with lots of TextureRegions
786     * @param spriteVertices vertices formatted as this class uses them; length should be a multiple of 24
787     * @param offset where to start drawing vertices from {@code spriteVertices}
788     * @param count how many vertices to draw from {@code spriteVertices} (24 vertices is one sprite)
789     */
790    public void drawExactly (Texture texture, float[] spriteVertices, int offset, int count) {
791        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
792
793        int verticesLength = vertices.length;
794        int remainingVertices = verticesLength;
795        if (texture != lastTexture)
796            switchTexture(texture);
797        else {
798            remainingVertices -= idx;
799            if (remainingVertices == 0) {
800                flush();
801                remainingVertices = verticesLength;
802            }
803        }
804        int copyCount = Math.min(remainingVertices, count);
805
806        System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, idx, copyCount);
807        idx += copyCount;
808        count -= copyCount;
809        while (count > 0) {
810            offset += copyCount;
811            flush();
812            copyCount = Math.min(verticesLength, count);
813            System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, 0, copyCount);
814            idx += copyCount;
815            count -= copyCount;
816        }
817    }
818
819    @Override
820    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float x, float y) {
821        draw(region, x, y, region.getRegionWidth(), region.getRegionHeight());
822    }
823
824    @Override
825    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float x, float y, float width, float height) {
826        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
827
828        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
829
830        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
831        if (texture != lastTexture) {
832            switchTexture(texture);
833        } else if (idx == vertices.length) {
834            flush();
835        }
836        final float fx2 = x + width;
837        final float fy2 = y + height;
838        final float u = region.getU();
839        final float v = region.getV2();
840        final float u2 = region.getU2();
841        final float v2 = region.getV();
842
843        final float color = this.color;
844        final float tweak = this.tweak;
845        final int idx = this.idx;
846        vertices[idx] = x;
847        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
848        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
849        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
850        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
851        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
852
853        vertices[idx + 6] = x;
854        vertices[idx + 7] = fy2;
855        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
856        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
857        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
858        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
859
860        vertices[idx + 12] = fx2;
861        vertices[idx + 13] = fy2;
862        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
863        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
864        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
865        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
866
867        vertices[idx + 18] = fx2;
868        vertices[idx + 19] = y;
869        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
870        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
871        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
872        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
873        this.idx = idx + 24;
874    }
875
876    @Override
877    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float x, float y, float originX, float originY, float width, float height,
878                      float scaleX, float scaleY, float rotation) {
879        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
880
881        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
882
883        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
884        if (texture != lastTexture) {
885            switchTexture(texture);
886        } else if (idx == vertices.length) //
887            flush();
888
889        // bottom left and top right corner points relative to origin
890        final float worldOriginX = x + originX;
891        final float worldOriginY = y + originY;
892        float fx = -originX;
893        float fy = -originY;
894        float fx2 = width - originX;
895        float fy2 = height - originY;
896
897        // scale
898        if (scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) {
899            fx *= scaleX;
900            fy *= scaleY;
901            fx2 *= scaleX;
902            fy2 *= scaleY;
903        }
904
905        // construct corner points, start from top left and go counter clockwise
906        final float p1x = fx;
907        final float p1y = fy;
908        final float p2x = fx;
909        final float p2y = fy2;
910        final float p3x = fx2;
911        final float p3y = fy2;
912        final float p4x = fx2;
913        final float p4y = fy;
914
915        float x1;
916        float y1;
917        float x2;
918        float y2;
919        float x3;
920        float y3;
921        float x4;
922        float y4;
923
924        // rotate
925        if (rotation != 0) {
926            final float cos = MathUtils.cosDeg(rotation);
927            final float sin = MathUtils.sinDeg(rotation);
928
929            x1 = cos * p1x - sin * p1y;
930            y1 = sin * p1x + cos * p1y;
931
932            x2 = cos * p2x - sin * p2y;
933            y2 = sin * p2x + cos * p2y;
934
935            x3 = cos * p3x - sin * p3y;
936            y3 = sin * p3x + cos * p3y;
937
938            x4 = x1 + (x3 - x2);
939            y4 = y3 - (y2 - y1);
940        } else {
941            x1 = p1x;
942            y1 = p1y;
943
944            x2 = p2x;
945            y2 = p2y;
946
947            x3 = p3x;
948            y3 = p3y;
949
950            x4 = p4x;
951            y4 = p4y;
952        }
953
954        x1 += worldOriginX;
955        y1 += worldOriginY;
956        x2 += worldOriginX;
957        y2 += worldOriginY;
958        x3 += worldOriginX;
959        y3 += worldOriginY;
960        x4 += worldOriginX;
961        y4 += worldOriginY;
962
963        final float u = region.getU();
964        final float v = region.getV2();
965        final float u2 = region.getU2();
966        final float v2 = region.getV();
967
968        final float color = this.color;
969        final float tweak = this.tweak;
970        final int idx = this.idx;
971        vertices[idx] = x1;
972        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
973        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
974        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
975        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
976        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
977
978        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
979        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
980        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
981        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
982        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
983        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
984
985        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
986        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
987        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
988        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
989        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
990        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
991
992        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
993        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
994        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
995        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
996        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
997        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
998        this.idx = idx + 24;
999    }
1000
1001    @Override
1002    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float x, float y, float originX, float originY, float width, float height,
1003                      float scaleX, float scaleY, float rotation, boolean clockwise) {
1004        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
1005
1006        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
1007
1008        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
1009        if (texture != lastTexture) {
1010            switchTexture(texture);
1011        } else if (idx == vertices.length) //
1012            flush();
1013
1014        // bottom left and top right corner points relative to origin
1015        final float worldOriginX = x + originX;
1016        final float worldOriginY = y + originY;
1017        float fx = -originX;
1018        float fy = -originY;
1019        float fx2 = width - originX;
1020        float fy2 = height - originY;
1021
1022        // scale
1023        if (scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) {
1024            fx *= scaleX;
1025            fy *= scaleY;
1026            fx2 *= scaleX;
1027            fy2 *= scaleY;
1028        }
1029
1030        // construct corner points, start from top left and go counter clockwise
1031        final float p1x = fx;
1032        final float p1y = fy;
1033        final float p2x = fx;
1034        final float p2y = fy2;
1035        final float p3x = fx2;
1036        final float p3y = fy2;
1037        final float p4x = fx2;
1038        final float p4y = fy;
1039
1040        float x1;
1041        float y1;
1042        float x2;
1043        float y2;
1044        float x3;
1045        float y3;
1046        float x4;
1047        float y4;
1048
1049        // rotate
1050        if (rotation != 0) {
1051            final float cos = MathUtils.cosDeg(rotation);
1052            final float sin = MathUtils.sinDeg(rotation);
1053
1054            x1 = cos * p1x - sin * p1y;
1055            y1 = sin * p1x + cos * p1y;
1056
1057            x2 = cos * p2x - sin * p2y;
1058            y2 = sin * p2x + cos * p2y;
1059
1060            x3 = cos * p3x - sin * p3y;
1061            y3 = sin * p3x + cos * p3y;
1062
1063            x4 = x1 + (x3 - x2);
1064            y4 = y3 - (y2 - y1);
1065        } else {
1066            x1 = p1x;
1067            y1 = p1y;
1068
1069            x2 = p2x;
1070            y2 = p2y;
1071
1072            x3 = p3x;
1073            y3 = p3y;
1074
1075            x4 = p4x;
1076            y4 = p4y;
1077        }
1078
1079        x1 += worldOriginX;
1080        y1 += worldOriginY;
1081        x2 += worldOriginX;
1082        y2 += worldOriginY;
1083        x3 += worldOriginX;
1084        y3 += worldOriginY;
1085        x4 += worldOriginX;
1086        y4 += worldOriginY;
1087
1088        float u1, v1, u2, v2, u3, v3, u4, v4;
1089        if (clockwise) {
1090            u1 = region.getU2();
1091            v1 = region.getV2();
1092            u2 = region.getU();
1093            v2 = region.getV2();
1094            u3 = region.getU();
1095            v3 = region.getV();
1096            u4 = region.getU2();
1097            v4 = region.getV();
1098        } else {
1099            u1 = region.getU();
1100            v1 = region.getV();
1101            u2 = region.getU2();
1102            v2 = region.getV();
1103            u3 = region.getU2();
1104            v3 = region.getV2();
1105            u4 = region.getU();
1106            v4 = region.getV2();
1107        }
1108
1109        final float color = this.color;
1110        final float tweak = this.tweak;
1111        final int idx = this.idx;
1112        vertices[idx] = x1;
1113        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
1114        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
1115        vertices[idx + 3] = u1;
1116        vertices[idx + 4] = v1;
1117        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
1118
1119        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
1120        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
1121        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
1122        vertices[idx + 9] = u2;
1123        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
1124        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
1125
1126        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
1127        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
1128        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
1129        vertices[idx + 15] = u3;
1130        vertices[idx + 16] = v3;
1131        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
1132
1133        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
1134        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
1135        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
1136        vertices[idx + 21] = u4;
1137        vertices[idx + 22] = v4;
1138        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
1139        this.idx = idx + 24;
1140    }
1141
1142    @Override
1143    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float width, float height, Affine2 transform) {
1144        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
1145
1146        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
1147
1148        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
1149        if (texture != lastTexture) {
1150            switchTexture(texture);
1151        } else if (idx == vertices.length) {
1152            flush();
1153        }
1154
1155        // construct corner points
1156        float x1 = transform.m02;
1157        float y1 = transform.m12;
1158        float x2 = transform.m01 * height + transform.m02;
1159        float y2 = transform.m11 * height + transform.m12;
1160        float x3 = transform.m00 * width + transform.m01 * height + transform.m02;
1161        float y3 = transform.m10 * width + transform.m11 * height + transform.m12;
1162        float x4 = transform.m00 * width + transform.m02;
1163        float y4 = transform.m10 * width + transform.m12;
1164
1165        float u = region.getU();
1166        float v = region.getV2();
1167        float u2 = region.getV2();
1168        float v2 = region.getV();
1169
1170        final float color = this.color;
1171        final float tweak = this.tweak;
1172        final int idx = this.idx;
1173        vertices[idx] = x1;
1174        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
1175        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
1176        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
1177        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
1178        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
1179
1180        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
1181        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
1182        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
1183        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
1184        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
1185        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
1186
1187        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
1188        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
1189        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
1190        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
1191        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
1192        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
1193
1194        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
1195        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
1196        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
1197        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
1198        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
1199        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
1200        this.idx = idx + 24;
1201    }
1202
1203    @SuppressWarnings("RedundantCast") // These casts are absolutely not redundant! Java 9 changed Buffer ABI.
1204    @Override
1205    public void flush () {
1206        if (idx == 0) return;
1207
1208        renderCalls++;
1209        totalRenderCalls++;
1210        int spritesInBatch = idx / SPRITE_SIZE;
1211        if (spritesInBatch > maxSpritesInBatch) maxSpritesInBatch = spritesInBatch;
1212        int count = spritesInBatch * 6;
1213
1214        lastTexture.bind();
1215        Mesh mesh = this.mesh;
1216        mesh.setVertices(vertices, 0, idx);
1217        ((Buffer)mesh.getIndicesBuffer()).position(0);
1218        ((Buffer)mesh.getIndicesBuffer()).limit(count);
1219
1220        if (blendingDisabled) {
1221            Gdx.gl.glDisable(GL20.GL_BLEND);
1222        } else {
1223            Gdx.gl.glEnable(GL20.GL_BLEND);
1224            if (blendSrcFunc != -1) Gdx.gl.glBlendFuncSeparate(blendSrcFunc, blendDstFunc, blendSrcFuncAlpha, blendDstFuncAlpha);
1225        }
1226
1227        mesh.render(customShader != null ? customShader : shader, GL20.GL_TRIANGLES, 0, count);
1228
1229        idx = 0;
1230    }
1231
1232    @Override
1233    public void disableBlending () {
1234        if (blendingDisabled) return;
1235        flush();
1236        blendingDisabled = true;
1237    }
1238
1239    @Override
1240    public void enableBlending () {
1241        if (!blendingDisabled) return;
1242        flush();
1243        blendingDisabled = false;
1244    }
1245
1246    @Override
1247    public void setBlendFunction (int srcFunc, int dstFunc) {
1248        setBlendFunctionSeparate(srcFunc, dstFunc, srcFunc, dstFunc);
1249    }
1250
1251    @Override
1252    public void setBlendFunctionSeparate(int srcFuncColor, int dstFuncColor, int srcFuncAlpha, int dstFuncAlpha) {
1253        if (blendSrcFunc == srcFuncColor && blendDstFunc == dstFuncColor && blendSrcFuncAlpha == srcFuncAlpha && blendDstFuncAlpha == dstFuncAlpha) return;
1254        flush();
1255        blendSrcFunc = srcFuncColor;
1256        blendDstFunc = dstFuncColor;
1257        blendSrcFuncAlpha = srcFuncAlpha;
1258        blendDstFuncAlpha = dstFuncAlpha;
1259    }
1260
1261    @Override
1262    public int getBlendSrcFunc () {
1263        return blendSrcFunc;
1264    }
1265
1266    @Override
1267    public int getBlendDstFunc () {
1268        return blendDstFunc;
1269    }
1270
1271    @Override
1272    public int getBlendSrcFuncAlpha() {
1273        return blendSrcFuncAlpha;
1274    }
1275
1276    @Override
1277    public int getBlendDstFuncAlpha() {
1278        return blendDstFuncAlpha;
1279    }
1280
1281    @Override
1282    public void dispose () {
1283        mesh.dispose();
1284        if (ownsShader && shader != null) shader.dispose();
1285    }
1286
1287    @Override
1288    public Matrix4 getProjectionMatrix () {
1289        return projectionMatrix;
1290    }
1291
1292    @Override
1293    public Matrix4 getTransformMatrix () {
1294        return transformMatrix;
1295    }
1296
1297    @Override
1298    public void setProjectionMatrix (Matrix4 projection) {
1299        if (drawing) flush();
1300        projectionMatrix.set(projection);
1301        if (drawing) setupMatrices();
1302    }
1303
1304    @Override
1305    public void setTransformMatrix (Matrix4 transform) {
1306        if (drawing) flush();
1307        transformMatrix.set(transform);
1308        if (drawing) setupMatrices();
1309    }
1310
1311    protected void setupMatrices () {
1312        combinedMatrix.set(projectionMatrix).mul(transformMatrix);
1313        if (customShader != null) {
1314            customShader.setUniformMatrix("u_projTrans", combinedMatrix);
1315            customShader.setUniformi("u_texture", 0);
1316        } else {
1317            shader.setUniformMatrix("u_projTrans", combinedMatrix);
1318            shader.setUniformi("u_texture", 0);
1319        }
1320    }
1321
1322    protected void switchTexture (Texture texture) {
1323        flush();
1324        lastTexture = texture;
1325        invTexWidth = 1.0f / texture.getWidth();
1326        invTexHeight = 1.0f / texture.getHeight();
1327    }
1328
1329    @Override
1330    public void setShader (ShaderProgram shader) {
1331        if (drawing) {
1332            flush();
1333        }
1334        customShader = shader;
1335        if (drawing) {
1336            if (customShader != null)
1337                customShader.bind();
1338            else
1339                this.shader.bind();
1340            setupMatrices();
1341        }
1342    }
1343
1344    @Override
1345    public ShaderProgram getShader () {
1346        if (customShader == null) {
1347            return shader;
1348        }
1349        return customShader;
1350    }
1351
1352    @Override
1353    public boolean isBlendingEnabled () {
1354        return !blendingDisabled;
1355    }
1356
1357    public boolean isDrawing () {
1358        return drawing;
1359    }
1360    static public final int X1 = 0;
1361    static public final int Y1 = 1;
1362    static public final int C1 = 2;
1363    static public final int U1 = 3;
1364    static public final int V1 = 4;
1365    static public final int T1 = 5;
1366    static public final int X2 = 6;
1367    static public final int Y2 = 7;
1368    static public final int C2 = 8;
1369    static public final int U2 = 9;
1370    static public final int V2 = 10;
1371    static public final int T2 = 11;
1372    static public final int X3 = 12;
1373    static public final int Y3 = 13;
1374    static public final int C3 = 14;
1375    static public final int U3 = 15;
1376    static public final int V3 = 16;
1377    static public final int T3 = 17;
1378    static public final int X4 = 18;
1379    static public final int Y4 = 19;
1380    static public final int C4 = 20;
1381    static public final int U4 = 21;
1382    static public final int V4 = 22;
1383    static public final int T4 = 23;
1384}
